DataElement.preferredName: Patient Gene Mutation Abnormality Receive Targeted Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that addresses genomic aberration and is receiving targeted therapy as outlined in  the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Gene Mutation Abnormality Receive Targeted Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function._Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer._To take, accept, or get something offered._A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Gene Mutation Abnormality Receive Targeted Therapy Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.:Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.:To take, accept, or get something offered.:A type of treatment that uses drugs or other substances, such as monoclonal antibodies, to identify and attack specific cancer cells. Targeted therapy may have fewer side effects than other types of cancer treatments.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

A type of cancer treatment that uses testing and medication to more precisely identify and treat cancer. These treatments target and disable genes or proteins necessary to the proliferation of cancer cells.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has NSCLC harborin
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has NSCLC harboring genomic aberrations (e.g. sensitizing EGFR, ALK,  ROS1, NTRK, BRAF V600E mutation positive), have they received prior treatment with FDA approved targeted therapy (for patients for which FDA approved targeted therapies is available)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Escalation cohort: If patient has NSCLC  known to harbor EGFR, ALK, ROS1, BRAF V600E/K activating mutations, has patient progressed on appropriate FDA-approved targeted therapies?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have therapeutically actionable mutation with approved targeted therapy (e.g. FGFR fusion patients are eligible for study therapy in the 3rd line setting)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have genomic evidence of inactivating ATM mutations, amplification of MYC, mutation of FBXW7, CCNE1 amplification, SWI/SNF member mutation (ARID1A, PBRM1, SMARCA4, ARID2, ARID1b, SMARCA2, SS18), and ATRX/DAXX?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have genomic evidence of inactivating ATM mutations, MYC amplification mutation of FBXW7, CCNE1 amplification, SWI/SNF member mutation (ARID1A, PBRM1, SMARCA4, ARID2, ARID1b, SMARCA2, SS18), and ATRX/DAXX?

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.21 AQT added per ticket request CADSR0002642. ak
